trans-unit.source: Building a Service
trans-unit.target: Building a Service

trans-unit.source: Building a Service for Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Building a Service for Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Using <token>sb1</token> requires creating and then <newTerm>hosting</newTerm> a Web service that registers itself with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Using <token>sb1</token> requires creating and then <newTerm>hosting</newTerm> a Web service that registers itself with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Hosting an application means instantiating and running a service that is configured to use a relay binding that connects to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Hosting an application means instantiating and running a service that is configured to use a relay binding that connects to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the hosted service is the originating service, which the application registers with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the hosted service is the originating service, which the application registers with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Clients then use the service endpoint exposed by <token>sb2</token>, which relays authorized messages to and from the originating service regardless of where it is physically located.
trans-unit.target: Clients then use the service endpoint exposed by <token>sb2</token>, which relays authorized messages to and from the originating service regardless of where it is physically located.

trans-unit.source: Note that, before you actually write the code that instantiates and runs a service, you must perform several steps.
trans-unit.target: Note that, before you actually write the code that instantiates and runs a service, you must perform several steps.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure describes the setup work necessary before hosting a <token>sb2</token> service.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure describes the setup work necessary before hosting a <token>sb2</token> service.

trans-unit.source: To set up a service for hosting
trans-unit.target: To set up a service for hosting

trans-unit.source: Design the <token>indigo2</token> contract for your service, as described in <link xlink:href="dfaace1b-c418-4e06-83cf-0261144ebd7a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Designing a .NET Services Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: Design the <token>indigo2</token> contract for your service, as described in <link xlink:href="dfaace1b-c418-4e06-83cf-0261144ebd7a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Designing a .NET Services Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: The contract, as a <token>indigo2</token> interface, is the same for both service and client applications.
trans-unit.target: The contract, as a <token>indigo2</token> interface, is the same for both service and client applications.

trans-unit.source: Implement the <token>indigo2</token> contract for your service.
trans-unit.target: Implement the <token>indigo2</token> contract for your service.

trans-unit.source: The implementation of the contract is used later, as part of the hosting process.
trans-unit.target: The implementation of the contract is used later, as part of the hosting process.

trans-unit.source: Configure your service, as defined in <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring a .NET Services Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: Configure your service, as defined in <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring a .NET Services Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configuration can be performed programmatically or through the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: Configuration can be performed programmatically or through the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Common scenarios include defining the service endpoint and security in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: Common scenarios include defining the service endpoint and security in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: These values are later used implicitly or explicitly, when the endpoints are created.
trans-unit.target: These values are later used implicitly or explicitly, when the endpoints are created.

trans-unit.source: Create the authorization and authentication credentials, as defined in <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating a .NET Services Connection</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create the authorization and authentication credentials, as defined in <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating a .NET Services Connection</link>.

trans-unit.source: As in the previous step, the credentials can be defined either programmatically or in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: As in the previous step, the credentials can be defined either programmatically or in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: After completing these steps, you can host your service.
trans-unit.target: After completing these steps, you can host your service.

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe the most common hosting scenarios and contain information to help with common issues related to hosting.
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe the most common hosting scenarios and contain information to help with common issues related to hosting.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to host a <token>sb2</token> service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to host a <token>sb2</token> service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a <token>indigo2</token> service host using the <token>azure_1</token> SDK.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a <token>indigo2</token> service host using the <token>azure_1</token> SDK.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to use the <token>indigo2</token> Web Programming Model to create and host a <token>indigo2</token> REST-style Web service that registers a REST service endpoint with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to use the <token>indigo2</token> Web Programming Model to create and host a <token>indigo2</token> REST-style Web service that registers a REST service endpoint with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes some of the important items to remember when hosting behind a firewall.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes some of the important items to remember when hosting behind a firewall.
